title: Urban Flood Warning (Medium)
intro: Heavy rainfall is forecast. Drains already overflowing near your street. You have 30 minutes before water may enter ground floors.

steps.question: You receive an official flood alert. What do you do first?

options.label: Check gov/municipal updates & evacuation routes
options.explain: Trusted info first reduces panic & misinformation.

options.label: Post on social media asking friends what to do
options.explain: Might help later, but slow and unreliable at start.

steps.question: Water starts pooling. What’s your immediate action?

options.label: Turn off mains electricity & move essentials upstairs
Drive your car out right now through water
options.explain: Flooded roads are unpredictable; risk of stalling/stranding.

options.label: Wait for a neighbour to coordinate
options.explain: Coordination is good, but act on safety first.

steps.question: Evacuation is advised in your zone. Choose:

options.label: Grab go‑bag (IDs, meds, water) & take recommended route
Take the shortest alley you know (not on the map)
Stay put; wait it out on ground floor

outcomes.title: Prepared
outcomes.message: You made timely choices and reduced risk for you & others.

outcomes.title: At Risk
outcomes.message: Mixed decisions. Improve speed & verify official routes.

title: Heatwave Advisory (High)
intro: A severe heatwave is forecast for 72 hours. Grid is under stress. Dehydration & heatstroke risks rising.

options.label: Plan hydration schedule & check on vulnerable neighbours
Close all windows and turn AC to lowest temp all day
Go for an afternoon run to ‘adapt’

steps.question: Midday outage hits. What’s your move?

options.label: Use passive cooling (shades, damp cloth, ventilate in evening)
Sit in a parked car with AC on for hours
Ignore the heat; continue screen time
Water, ORS, light meals; avoid caffeine/alcohol

outcomes.title: Moderate
outcomes.message: Some good choices; refine hydration & cooling.
